website_summaries.verdict: An excellent replacement for the MagSafe power adapter.
pros: Lets you add a MagSafe connector to a MacBook that's without one
cons: The adapter is awkwardly long and the inflexible cable means things can accidentally unplug quite easily

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff to be convenient
customer_reviews.text: As others have written, the original magsafe Apple power cord was fantastic. When I got the new MacBook Pro I was shocked to see it didn't have that same feature. I have been terribly disappointed in this product. The cord is extremely stiff, making it very frustrating to use. Its impossible to move the computer without the cord popping out. That is EXTREMELY inconvenient all day long. I hope I can find another one that works better. I would NOT buy this. It certainly works, so it deserves a star, but its an awful product.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: I recommend you look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a few weeks. Then it stopped. There was no harsh treatment to cause its malfunction. It just stopped conducting power. Perhaps our experience was a one-off, but it was an expensive one indeed. I recommend you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: James Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, and magnet is too weak. F grade on Fakespot for 85% fake reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Fakespot shows that the reviews were an F grade and more than 80% are fake. And the magnet is so weak and it barely connected after a week's use. Overpriced. Worth seeing if Griffin has improved this in the new version that's coming this year.
customer_reviews.author: Cinncinatus C.

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this cable
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm happy with this cable. As other reviewers have noted, the cable is thicker, and therefore somewhat less flexible, than the cord on Apple's MagSafe connector. This means that moving the computer around might cause the magnetic connector to part more easily. But in my experience the magnets aren't nearly as weak as some reviewers have reported. It works fine for tabletop use; it takes a little more care during lap use. I would never, as Griffin suggests, leave the USB-C piece plugged into my computer, as it's fairly large and would cause damage it if got knocked when carrying the computer around. The fact that the magnetic link between the two pieces isn't reversible hasn't been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: French River

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Most of my issues were raised by previous reviewers. To summarize: Pros: *Restore MagSafe-like functionality Cons: * Bulky * Magnet interferes with adjacent port (on my MacBookPro) * Cable is too stiff/magnet too weak and so power disconnects when you move the computer a bit (e.g., on your lap) * Cable a bit too short * Unlike mag-safe, there is polarity, so you have to twist the cable to match the orientation of the computer-side plug
customer_reviews.author: Nir Friedman

customer_reviews.title: The magnets in this are too weak, so the cable connection is intermittent
customer_reviews.text: The magnet in the connector is too weak to give a reliable connection. Just the weight of the cable on a flat desktop is enough to make the connection go off and on frequently, which is both annoying and might damage whatever you're trying to charge with it. Additionally, the end you plug into your laptop is so big it isn't safe to leave it plugged in when you put the laptop in a bag, but it's small enough to lose in your bag. I lost track of mine for a week the first time I stuck it in my bag because I was foolish enough to believe it'd stick to the end of its cable.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Block

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As Apple's MagSafe
customer_reviews.text: For starters, the unit that plugs into my MacBook Air leaves a small 1⁄8" gap. Second, there is no indication that it's charging but the laptop does chime when you connect it to the power supply even if the sound is muted. Third thing is the thickness of the cord that plugs into the power supply brick. Its thickness makes it quite inflexible. So if you have the laptop connected to its power supply and you happen to move, it breaks the magnetic connector that doesn't seem to be too powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Siron

customer_reviews.title: Meh.  Good idea.  Weak magnets.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It works, and it charges...when it's attached. The problem is it doesn't stay attached. I realize it's supposed to detach to protect the computer, but the magnets are so weak that it detaches in situations where the computer was never in any danger. Cat bumps the cable? It detaches. Strong breeze? It detaches. Look at it funny? It detaches. It's almost useless as a charging cable if you have to babysit it to make sure it's actually still attached. I'd also love it if there was some sort of indicator as to whether there was actual power flowing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Oehler

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but not satisfactory enough for regular use.
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfactory enough for use. Yes, the cable will break away if someone trips over it during charging, as advertised. But the portion that plugs into the laptop sticks out too far to be left in permanently, and pulling out both parts together every time is a fiddle. And there's a good chance of misplacing the plug-in part. Also, the connection breaks more easily than with the old Apple MagSafe, which can be a nuisance. More trouble than it's worth: I used it a few times then retired it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip L. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After Light Use
customer_reviews.text: Boy do I miss the magsafe on my new mac, but that's another review. I thought I had found the perfect solution with this. Alas, it was not so. It's worked okay to begin with, but soon became finicky, and then eventually stopped working altogether. The little nib that you have to keep in your power port is also annoying, and feels like it could easily snap off in a bag, or could be lost. Bottom line: it stopped working after light duty, so I can not recommend this. In the meantime, if you're reading this Apple, I think a lot of us will take a few extra millimeters on our computers to have our beloved magsafe back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Cable easily disconects or falls out
customer_reviews.text: the cable is extremely stiff compared to the Apple cable used with mag safe connectors. As such, it constantly disconnects with any movement. Also, because it is so stiff, it does not like to bend over or around as a normal charging cable would and will disconnect with otherwise normal use. The other usb-c end falls out of the Apple power block constantly and does not connect securely. I would have returned but waited a few days too long. I have written Griffen warranty/customer service and am awaiting their reply.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky_Riccardo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month of use.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great alternative to the Magsafe, and I was happy with the magnet strength. Bought in early December. By the end of December I noticed that sometimes it wouldn't charge my Macbook. It would be plugged in, and the battery indicator would be showing that it's charging, but the battery percentage would keep going down. I'd unplug and plug back in and it would finally work again. Now it's not working at all. I know it's this cable because when I plug in the normal USB-C cable, it charges up fine. Disappointed and will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Should have been built-in by Apple
customer_reviews.text: When I upgraded from my 2013 Retina MacBook Pro to a 2020 MacBook Pro, everything was great...except using those small and kind of "sticky" USB C ports. They're fine for plugging in occasional use items like backup drives and whatnot, but for AC adapters, I REALLY missed the Magsafe connector. The Griffin works well, especially as a 3rd party add on. I keep the small USB C plug in the left rear jack (which is where the Magsafe used to be on the older MacBooks), and I have a couple of these systems in different locations to make it easy to attach and detach power.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Here today, gone tomorrow...
customer_reviews.text: I've used Griffin products for years successfully - this is not one of the good ones. It worked fine for several months, then suddenly stopped working consistently. It reconnects constantly while charging between its disconnects. Don't bother!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Glass

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnets weaken over time
customer_reviews.text: I would have initially ranked this as a 3 or 4 star product. I would have removed the stars because of the size of the magnet and the fact that it would disconnect if you moved it. I have now had it for 4 months and the cable disconnects without any movement. It physically remains connected but no longer charges until you press it in gently. The magnet itself does not block the adjacent USB port for a standard sized USB-C cable but does prevent anything larger (such as my USB-3 to USB-C dongles) from being used in it. I would not recommend this product until it is updated.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair J. Windsor

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Life Saving Laptop Accessory!
customer_reviews.text: This elegant and stylish cable is a lifesaver! Neat functional break away design is a must have! Magnet is strong enough to secure the charging cable, but will come away if your cord is tripped over or stepped on. Get this cord to prevent your laptop from accidental damage from falling. Definitely worth the minimal cost to prevent having to replace your laptop, especially if you purchased a high end computer. A few dollars invested can save you thousands in replacement costs and inconvenience! A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer!

customer_reviews.title: Need to do better
customer_reviews.text: Most of the problem I read about this product has to do with the magnet being too weak. I didn't find that to be an issue. The major problem I have with the product is that it's not a tight fit. The magnetic piece that fits into my computer is way too loose. For this reason I'm going to replace the product with something that fits better. I can't take the chance of ruining my port on the computer. It's a Shame because the cable is sturdy cable and it works great. 2 stars for the cable quality
customer_reviews.author: Keyan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but needs a more flexible cord
customer_reviews.text: This item does what it is supposed to do - it restores the magnetic safety capacity to the power cord on the new Macs that, sadly, no longer have that capacity. However, the cord itself is very stiff and this causes the magnet to dislodge when the computer is re-positioned. You have to position the computer carefully to maintain the connection with the very stiff cord. I would still recommend this item as it is better than not having this safety feature, but it could be improved by having the cord made from more flexible material.
customer_reviews.author: Paprika

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was missing out on the magsafe from the MacBook pros. It works as advertised and is probably the most high quality cable that I have ever owned. The only real downside to this is the ease that the cable comes off, they could have made the magnets a little stronger so that it does not separate when you move your device. Pros: -Excellent quality cable -Extra level of protection Cons: -Expensive -Magnets could be stronger If you have a laptop or tablet that charges using USB Type C, this is a must have safety feature.
customer_reviews.author: jkash99

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Just as It Is
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I don't try to use my laptop while it's plugged in, unless I'm sitting at my desk, but it's ideal for letting my computer recharge when I'm not using it. I then unplug and take my laptop with me. It has already saved me from a number of accidents. Yes, the cable is stiff, and yes, the magnet portion breaks away quite easily. Neither of these really detracts from the utility of the device. I much prefer its minor drawbacks to the prospect of a very stiff USB-C charger yanking my computer to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: PPG

customer_reviews.title: It's too big,
customer_reviews.text: It's too big, it does not allow another cable to be plugged freely into the other USB connector C of the computer
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Salgado

customer_reviews.title: Tiny pieces are a problem
customer_reviews.text: The breakaway is a great idea but it creates a problem--a tiny little plug that sticks out from the computer and is prone to getting lost. I lost it, ended up buying a new and more inexpensive usb-c Amazon Essentials plug, and then found the tiny piece later but have never returned to using the breakaway plug again.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Almost, but not quite strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't quite live up to the expectations set by our MagSafe connectors of previous MacBook generations. While it works as described, I have found 2 annoying problems with its usage: 1) the magnetic strength is not sufficient enough to prevent it from getting detached during normal usage on uneven surfaces, like the couch or the bed. It will become detach even by only slight vertical pressure. 2) the portion of the connector that does not separate from the laptop is just slightly too large. It can easily get caught on things while handling it, causing me to always remove it when I am moving the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bronner

customer_reviews.title: works great and has the feel of high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Gave a big sigh of relief when I could stop worrying about the power connection for my new MacBook Pro. Pops off easily with no stress on the computer. Strong magnet makes connection very easy.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Has bad tendency to disconnect too often due to heavy
customer_reviews.text: Has bad tendency to disconnect too often due to heavy, relatively inflexible cord. The weight of the cord will often case disconnection. Had to work around by molding a plastic sleeve that supports bottom of cord connector. A thinner cable and shorter USB-C nub with upward support for the cord. Definitely leaves room for another company to make a better equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kuo

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected - easy pop off connection
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product - cable is very heavy and not very flexible - therefore if you reposition your laptop it tends to disconnect too easily and I found that what i thought was a charging connection was not! - I had to trim the edge of my MacBook protective Encase cover in order for the C connection to properly fit into the USB C port. I have since found a better magsafe connector that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've used this charger for a couple of months now ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this charger for a couple of months now so I can finally say, overall it's just okay. The USB-C cable is strong, but the magnetic is just too loose for my liking. I bought this charger initially to travel with because I figured it would just be more convenient and safe when I'm outside and someone happens to trip on the wire. It was just too loose.. so that's why I had to knock a star off this review. It's not a slow charge, but it's definitely not fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Chang

customer_reviews.title: Better than Apple
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the Apple cables. Wish Apple would ship these instead. I only wish they had the breakaway on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tragic

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lot of improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought this product without reading the reviews first (my mistake) My experience wasnt good. I have a 13 inch macbook pro with touch bar. And it doesnt work on the left usbc port of the computer, it does works on the right side ports but that is annoying. the charing rate is slower than it would be with the original apple cable, and the magnet is so weak it will desconect with the minimum movement, that was the worst. Last, i think the price is to high for what it offers. I wish i had keep the package so i could return it. I dont recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Griffin BreakSafe Breakaway Power Cable for USB-C Laptops and attempted to attach it to my new MacBook Air. The small magnetic part did not insert completely into either of the ports. Perhaps it wasn't supposed to, which is okay (although aesthetically annoying), but I got only a sporadic connection to the power source. Without even moving my laptop, the connection went off and on randomly. I am packaging it up and returning it today. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Cindy McMillion

customer_reviews.title: Just wait for better alternatives
customer_reviews.text: Just wait till other companies start making alternatives. It gets scratched easily, it barley stays connected and it doesn't even plug in all the way. For the asking price it is essentially robbery. It should be at most 19 dollars as it doesn't tell transfer data and is massively larger than it should be. It is not so much that the technology isn't there... more it is just made cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Abdelrahim

customer_reviews.title: Like many other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews, we find the magnet insufficient to stay connected if the laptop is moved from a stationary position. If you plan on leaving your laptop in once place, the Breakaway will work fine . If you plan to pickup and move your laptop about, you may find the frequent disconnects frustrating. We returned the Breakaway and will wait for a better solution. Until then, we'll use the included USB-C to USB-C cable.
customer_reviews.author: SKPnSF

customer_reviews.title: No good.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly WEAK magnet! The cable is heavy gauge which is great but the weight from the cable will disconnect it from the magnet at the slightest provocation. Just moving the laptop slightly and it disconnects the magnet. The laptop will be sitting on a desk feeding a monitor so it may be okay but if it disconnects frequently I'll be ditching this cable. The cable had no problems charging my 2017 MBP. Bottom line...Griffin need to invest in some stronger magnets.
customer_reviews.author: Aceman

customer_reviews.title: Cable broke within months, nothing about my experience with this cable sparks joy
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviews state, the design of the magnet itself is awful. The cord is heavy enough to disconnect the magnet. Don't expect the great user experience that you once got out of Apple's magsafe. Also note, this cable is NOT compatible with the 15" MacBook, even with lower wattage power bricks. My cable totally died and griffin is unwilling to issue me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot but I definitely missed the MagSafe ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the new MacBook Pro with TouchBar. I like it a lot but I definitely missed the MagSafe connector for power. I purchased this Griffin cable hoping it would fill in. It is ALMOST a good cable. The issue is that the magnet is just not strong enough. If you breathe on it wrong, it falls off. It will do for now but I will still be on the lookout for something better.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: It comes apart way too easily. It disconnects and the slightest kink
customer_reviews.text: It comes apart way too easily. It disconnects and the slightest kink. I've left my MacBook plugged in and it has disconnected because it disconnected when I was setting it down. It was 40 bucks that were wasted. Just get a regular cord and try not to pull it out of your Macbook.
customer_reviews.author: RevFrThumos

customer_reviews.title: Keeping alive a great idea for MacBook power cables
customer_reviews.text: In Apple's quest to remove all extraneous portal, it abandoned one of its best features by dropping Magsafe. This is a perfectly designed alternative that works as advertised. Not sure how long the silicon cladding will hold up (some soft-touch computer accessories get quite disgusting after a couple years) but it's worth the price to have this convenient cable.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Trenn

customer_reviews.title: Unusable because of stiff cord.
customer_reviews.text: Unusable! The cord is so stiff that the slightest movement will cause it to disconnect. I will have to order another cable to use with my 2nd charger.
customer_reviews.author: D. Grassi

customer_reviews.title: Clunky Attempt at MagSafe Plug
customer_reviews.text: Unsatisfactory MacBook MagSafe alternative. Both the plug-in dongle and the magnetic power plug are large and clunky. The power cable is inexplicably stiff and awkward. On my MacBook, I really missed the MagSafe plug included in my previous MacBook Air and was initially very pleased to find that Griffin created an aftermarket magnetic plug. However, this is a poorly designed, clunky product -- not an elegant addition to your MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: JSM

customer_reviews.title: Will never pull your computer off a table by tripping on cord
customer_reviews.text: Magnets could be stronger. Cord could be white not black for visibility on dark rugs at night. I added white shrink tube to both ends of black cord for visibility and strengthening flex terminals.
customer_reviews.author: master craftsman

customer_reviews.title: stops working
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in August 2018, which stopped working, so I bought another one in August 2019. I've only been using it five months and it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Guayacan

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but the cable is too rigid and heavy, so it often disconnects itself from the magnet. The detachable end piece is also rather large, which makes it protrude quite a lot from whatever device it is connected in. This partially defeats the purpose of the cable, because now the USB plug itself is at risk of getting struck and bent even if the cable detaches.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It's not MagSafe, but it will break away when ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not MagSafe, but it will break away when the kids or dogs catch the cord. Only connects magnetically in one direction, so put the line side up to make it easier to remember.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy cable
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant when I bought this cable since I read a lot of reviews that thought that the magnets were too weak and the cable itself was too rigid. The cable is indeed more rigid than the original one, that's not a problem for me in any way. The magnet doesn't drop off from it's weight or randomly disconnect from my use so far, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great MagSafe substitute although not quite as secure
customer_reviews.text: missed the MagSafe connection on the new MacBookPro so this is a great solution. It works pretty well and really provides protection from dragging your laptop on the floor if you happen to trip over the charging cord. The magnet is not as strong as the apple version and because the cord is rather inflexible moving the computer can resulting in breaking the connection. This is a minor grouse, but does drop my rating by 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Blimey

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived
customer_reviews.text: Short in the cord within three days. Lasted for four more days if cord was at "just the right angle" at one week, short became such that it would no longer charge.
customer_reviews.author: A.Non

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning cable
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 29 December 2019. Sadly it's working occasionally. It's plugged in show charging but it's stay on the same battery level. The magnetic part gets very hot. It's clean and undamaged. I REALLY don't know what make this situation. Hope to get contact roey969@gmail.com.
customer_reviews.author: Roey

customer_reviews.title: So far working great
customer_reviews.text: Our old cable became frayed and this one has held up as a great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Joan D

customer_reviews.title: Looks good on paper but is unusable
customer_reviews.text: The cable seems like a great idea on paper but while using it I found that the MagSafe barely stays on. In an airplane it's super problematic because the cable is very stiff and pulls on the MagSafe too much. After using it a few time the MagSafe connection started to overheat and the cable became unusable. Unfortunately since the box is gone there is no way to retrieve the purchase price for this useless cable. I would stay away from this product for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Yuriyr

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Google pixel xl
customer_reviews.text: Not a good choice. The magnetic connection is wear and the magnet part is HUGE! It does not work with my Google Pixel in it's OtterBox. I was thinking it would be a small magnetic piece. It's also too weak for my MacBook pro.
customer_reviews.author: V. Mariano

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect solution for on the go...
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for doing its job as advertised. This product has a very weak magnet to hold the cable in place, any slight bump and it pops off. For a stationary workstation this product is great and insurers your device won't topple with a cable trip but for on the go you will find it extremely annoying how little force pops the connection off.
customer_reviews.author: •Storbeck Family•

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised but the weakness of the magnet holding ...
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised but the weakness of the magnet holding it in place makes it a much more frustrating product than it needs to be. I know there has to be a balance between magnet strength and the ability for it to release when accidentally tugged on but I don't feel that Griffin achieve that balance what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Tech junkie 64

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine for the first few weeks, but soon stopped working. There are some similar reviews - where the product stopped working after a few weeks but I thought I'd take a chance anyway. Now am wishing i did not.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Product works fine and as show in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Product works fine and as show in the pictures. Keep in mind the following limitations due to the size of the USB-C insert: (1) if you have protective case on the MacBook you will have to remove it to charge the device and (2) if you add a dongle to say connect an external monitor, in my case an original Apple HDMI, you cannot use it as the USB-C insert is too large. So I recommend it for someone that is just trying to use it to charge a MacBook without a case and not planning on using it with any of the adaptors.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: A Product fit for the MacBook pro.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product and works well to easily disengage the power cord from the computer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, poor execution... obviously, they could not have made a product that worked as perfectly as Apple's MagSafe. The magnetic connection is finicky, orientation sensitive and comes off a bit too easily. Still trying to get into the habit of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Mehboob Alam

customer_reviews.title: Not magnetic enough
customer_reviews.text: Sounded like a really good product and I thought it would be something like Apple's old chargers. Not at all what I expected. It is barely magnetic and it disconnects if you touch it slightly. If it was more magnetic, I feel like it would be better. But for now, it is really not worth that money.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Product is trash. DO NOT BUY. USELESS. Returned mine on day 3.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! I've had this for less than a week and it's already trash, returning it ASAP. Using the latest kaby 2017 MBP 15"- 90% of the time the computer doesn't even recognize it / charge. The other 10% of the time the slightest tap will break the connection, even the weight of the wire is enough to break the connection, complete rubbish. There appear to be LEDs on both side of the megnetic connector similar to the OEM magsafe LED to indicate charging/fully charged... Except Griffin's LEDs do absolutely nothing, don't even light up. No idea how this has good reviews. Hopefully this saves some people wasted time and trouble with this literal junk.
customer_reviews.author: dwaz

customer_reviews.title: Magnet strength too low
customer_reviews.text: This product has a few problems, especially when compared to Mac's magsafe1 which is excellent and magsafe2 is good, though detaches a bit too easily. This product detaches too easily, likely due to a combination of weakness of the magnets and rigidity of the cable. While the cable is more durable and will probably not suffer from fraying problems that Apple's cables have, the cable is heavier and stiffer leading it to break away its connection at the lightest touches.
customer_reviews.author: B. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Works and protects Macbook
customer_reviews.text: I like the safety it provides so I do not drag it off a desk in a motel when I am travelling
customer_reviews.author: cwm1949

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 18 months, inflexible wiring.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these cords, and each has stopped working after 18 month. The cable does not handle moving around. If you always keep it on your desk, fine, but if you move around with your laptop the internal wiring breaks withing 18 months. I wish another company would make one with more flexible wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Blackall

customer_reviews.title: Magnet just falls off
customer_reviews.text: The product looks great in concept, but doesn't really deliver. At first the magnet is strong, but then afterward it is so weak is just falls off rather easily.
customer_reviews.author: TheRealDarknerd

customer_reviews.title: Quality product but charges a little bit slower.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item from BestBuy and I must say it actually does quite well. I do think though it charges slower than if you were to use a USB-C. I have had my Griffin Mag charging cable for almost a year and have had no problems as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I have a 2017 Macbook Pro and I have replaced ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2017 Macbook Pro and I have replaced the OEM cable with this. I keep the breakaway piece permanently attached to one of my USB-C ports and have had no issues with the connection or with charging the laptop. The cable is sturdily built and holding up well to the rigors of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: BevilUS Wooding

customer_reviews.title: The metal wrapper of magnet head is loose from the ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal wrapper of magnet head is loose from the body when I pull out the cable. It needs to be more robust.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Ok Charger
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new MacBook pro, but it's just not as strong as my previous MacBook chargers. The magnet comes apart if you move it at all, so it's not good for charging anywhere else except a desk.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Cord
customer_reviews.text: Cord is heavy and hard to pack in computer bag. The black cord may be objectionable for some people (not a problem for me). Certainly they could have used a better and lighter cord. Also need an adapter for a USB-C power supply.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: but they tried their best with the magnets
customer_reviews.text: It might break away too much, but they tried their best with the magnets. It works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Already saved my new MacBook Pro form falling
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure glad I decided to purchase this product! I has saved my new computer from falling on the floor. I do wish the cord was a little longer...at least for my personal use. It may be perfectly fine for anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay attached.  Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: In theory this is a great product, just like my old matchbook connector. BUT, the magnet is terrible and very weak. The cord will not stay attached. I don't mind the size, but why would you make a magnetic product which will not stay attached? I would not recommend buying this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Durocher

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea Materialized in a Less-Than-Mediocre Product
customer_reviews.text: While a great idea–pre-Magsafe I bent/damaged my laptop power port more than once through cable entanglement–the Griffin Breaksafe cable fails in practice. The magnet is too weak, combined with a bulk oversized plug end that seems to exacerbate the weak magnet. With my Macbook on my lap, the cable frequently disconnects. Picking it up or putting it down is guaranteed to knock the cable consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan McAdams

customer_reviews.title: stiff wire that easily detaches. Could be better
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers noted, stiff wire that easily detaches. Could be better, but also sort of the point. Would like a stronger connection, but definitely better than taking the USB c cable when the dog unexpectedly comes running by!
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, but the slightest jiggle of the cable causes the computer to stop charging (even if the cable pieces are still completely attached). Yet another useless dongle for this useless computer.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but not a great solution.
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this is great, but it protrudes too far out of the computer when magnetic piece is detached, meaning it could easily get knocked and damage computer just like Apple's power cable. It's also a bit hard to take out of computer. Seems to stick a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cable is ok but needs a stronger magnet!
customer_reviews.text: Item is ok but the break away magnet is very week. I put my laptop in my lap constantly and it always breaks off. It needs a better magnet and then i would give this thing a better rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Frasure

customer_reviews.title: Too big and clunky!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's just too big and the magnet is not strong. The cable material is thick and stiff, unlike an original Apple cable. A much better idea would be a connector that fits on the Apple cable (but Griffin wants to include the cable to get the price up, which is understandable). It's just hard to believe that this great idea ended up with this product. This product could not of been tested by real users.
customer_reviews.author: Brewski

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! I've always had the magnetic charging when ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! I've always had the magnetic charging when it comes to the MacBooks. But now with in actual plug in I'm always worried I will break it. This charger was the best purchase. Haven't had any issues, charges great, and releases when it's in a position that would have ended up breaking the charger it comes with. If you're considering this product, pull the trigger and buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing annoyed me more than it being useful
customer_reviews.text: This thing annoyed me more than it being useful. Any sort of movement causes it to disconnect. I don't like that it sticks out almost an inch from the laptop. Went back to the standard USB-C connector to charge and nervously watch my laptop cords. This product needs a lot of improvement.
customer_reviews.author: toadkicker

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea flawed design
customer_reviews.text: The magnet just isn't strong enough to keep this on. Nice idea flawed design. We stopped using it after 1 week. Pain in the butt
customer_reviews.author: Jacob V.

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a little while
customer_reviews.text: Served the intended purpose for a little while. After 7 months of use it just stopped working. It was kept at a desktop setting so it’s not that it was mishandled
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lestage

customer_reviews.title: But overall a good product. It is true that the cable is ...
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic connection is not the strongest. But overall a good product. It is true that the cable is stiff, but its a good option for those who miss magsafe. It charges just as well as a the regular charger. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: magnetic connection
customer_reviews.text: everything is good but one side tip is short so it easily falls out from the device
customer_reviews.author: Manish Karkee

customer_reviews.title: Good idea on paper but it simply does not work ...
customer_reviews.text: Good idea on paper but it simply does not work as a replacement of the familiar magSafe. The magnet in the connector is simply not strong enough so the cable tends to disconnect even when minimum force is applied to it.
customer_reviews.author: Samaridis N.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Great way to turn the computer on without unplugging everything! Adds a great deal of pure convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as the Apple original, but it works and is a godsend if you ever kick the cable. My only complaints are the cable is a little stiff, so it is more likely to pop-off, and you can only plug it in one-way. Otherwise, is definitely worth getting
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work for my new MacBook Pro but it just doesn't unfortunately. My computer recognizes it and says it's charging but it was loosing battery power while I was trying to charge it. I wish I had kept the packaging so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Why Different

customer_reviews.title: Works just like Apple’s Mag-Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Has saved me from dragging my computer off the table or breaking the charging port many times.
customer_reviews.author: Dale P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: The only issue is that the USB-C than connects to the MacBook Pro is bulky and it has to be removed to use the leather sleeve. Good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Maturana

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Away Way too easily... 😒
customer_reviews.text: Good quality cable, but the break away part comes apart was too easily. Ever time i move my laptop it come apart. Not good...
customer_reviews.author: Welton Gite

customer_reviews.title: I’ve only used it once so I hope I’ll be able to use it for years like my other Apple cables
customer_reviews.text: Really liking it. I’ve only used it once so I hope I’ll be able to use it for years like my other Apple cables. The box was rather dented and the tape that holds the box’s flap shut looked like it’s been opened (see first picture) although the other side’s flap seems to be untouched (see second picture) :( I shall use it a few more times and see if there are any issues, if not it should be fine
customer_reviews.author: Isadora

customer_reviews.title: Like original breaksafe
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful item. Don’t hesitate like I did. Very close to original breaksafe
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Seely

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for USB-C charging. It's already saved my computer and the cable itself twice. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Connector is wide and blocks the other USB C port on a MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic Release is Back!
customer_reviews.text: Wish the magnet was a little stronger like rare earth magnets
customer_reviews.author: Expediter

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice long cable. Well made and appears to be around for the long haul. I've avoiding knocking over my laptop while using this so many times already. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good, but its design make it weak
customer_reviews.author: Hai K

customer_reviews.title: Used sparingly for about two months and the cable stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: Used sparingly for about two months and the cable stopped working out of no where. Doesn't conduct electricity to the laptop doesn't charge it... nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ramses Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Cable thick and not Flexible.
customer_reviews.text: Cable thick and not Flexible. Plus the Type-C connector protrudes a good way out of the Macbook and disconnects a lot... I went back to the stock Apple cable - just be careful. If these were lighter weight cables (flexible) and the ends were less bulky the idea is a good one... but I am not going to be using them as they are.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Truth

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in this cable
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this cable, mostly because the magnets they've used aren't nearly as strong as the ones Apple used to have on their mag-safe cables. As a result the cable comes undone rather easily even when you'd like it to stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: mzog

customer_reviews.title: I like the cable but wish it was available in colors that would match the other MacBooks
customer_reviews.text: I bought two USB hubs that match my space gray MacBook so why can't this charger match as well?
customer_reviews.author: Kendall L. Vaughan

product_meta.title: Griffin BreakSafe Magnetic USB-C Breakaway Power Cable for MacBooks and Chromebook Pixel
product_meta.description: Apple's MagSafe connector has saved literally millions of laptops from destruction caused by tripping over one's power cord. But with the introduction of USB-C on new MacBooks, this safety feature is absent. The BreakSafe Connector BreakSafe's patented quick-release magnetic connector plugs into your laptop's USB-C port and safely disconnects from the rest of the cable when under stress or strain, like tripping over the power cord. The streamlined magnetic connector is only 12.8 mm deep so you can leave it plugged into your laptop's USB-C port when not in use. BreakSafe is Designed to Protect your Laptop and You Because it is designed to carry power sufficient to charge your laptop's battery (up to 60 watts), BreakSafe incorporates four different safety features to protect you and your laptop from accidental or intentional misuse: Visual: Visual markings on the connector housing show the user the correct way to attach the cable and connector. Magnetic: BreakSafe's magnets only allow it to be connected the correct way, and ensure the cord's polarity is consistent with both the power supply and the device being powered. Structural: BreakSafe has two small keys molded into its magnetic connector that physically prevent the magnets from engaging, and prevent the cable from connecting incorrectly. Electrical: BreakSafe's central ground pin is the first conductive element to touch when joining the cable and connector. This ensures that any static electrical charges are dissipated before the cable begins passing power from supply to device. Using BreakSafe Use BreakSafe with the USB-C power supply that came with your laptop. BreakSafe is rated up to 60 watts (20 volts @ 3 amps), and has been designed and tested to meet USB-C power standards
feature_bullets: Compatible with Apple's MacBook (12") and other devices that charge via USB-C
BreakSafe is rated up to 60 watts (20 volts at 3 amps) power
Designed and tested to meet USB-C power standards
Data and video are not supported
In the box: USB-C magnetic connector, USB-C cable
